intro: Leptopus fangdingianus, commonly known as the Fangdingian stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
